p:
Due to the natural deviation of sexual transmission from a basic mass-action contact rate, as stated in the model, we should apply a correction to
R 0 *
to accommodate the distribution of the number of sexual partners men have (since we are only considering sexually-transmitted infections). According to Anderson and May [ 25] (Chapter 11, page 233), this correction factor c is given by the expression
c = m +
s 2
/ m
, where m is the mean number of sexual partners in the population and
s 2
is its variance. We found the value of
c = 2.154
using male partner distribution data (
m = 1.339
,
s 2
= 1.0917
) from a sexual behavior survey. All simulations were done with this correction.
